comment:
ALEKS homework was ALL due at the end of the semester.
She streamed her lectures on Teams, so if you couldn't make it to campus you could still learn. 
Attendance taken on a clipboard, but no grade attached.
Would finish the unit a few days before the test, then do review on the board. Practice tests too.
Funny & sweet, great with accommodations.

Avoid her class if you can. She reads straight from PowerPoints and offers little help outside of allowing notes on tests. If you struggle with math, she's often rude and may mock you in front of others. The class environment is unsupportive and not helpful for learning. I did not learn a thing all semester.

Maybe we didn't mesh well together, but I feel like she was really not helpful and at times purposefully not helpful to me when I had questions in class. I could not access the online exam, and she didn't really respond until days later, not really trying to help me access it either. she's pretty annoying to me tbh but again, we didn't mesh well.

Really nice & relaxed professor and was very energetic. All homework is on ALEKS which gives you a lot of good review & practice. She gives 4 tests + final that are similar to the practice tests. She also gives 10 question quizzes on ALEKS due a few days later which helped out my grade a lot. Only thing that's difficult are some of the concepts.

Chill Professor No unnecessary stress
open note tests (use presentation slides)
Don't get too comfortable with the freedom and forget to finish assignments
No review unless you ask
Attendance taken on an open sign-in sheet 
Assignments on Pearson (homework modules, review quizzes, and Exams) 
Online lectures offered if sick/ can't show up in class

Take her if you can, she understands you have other classes to take. Her exams are only 10 questions and are very easy, no lockdown and you can use your notes. You can choose whether you want to take it on paper or not. She is very nice and cares about you!

I loved professor Sandee. She is so sweet and understanding and made math for me (which I hate and struggle with) fun and easy. she would explain things very well if you do not understand. Also there is a lot of ALEKS but it was all open so you could finish it all at once. Loved taking her class and would love to take it again.

There's not enough space to describe how amazing Professor Sandee is. I took her for Algebra in the spring and Precalc this fall. She even buys calculators out of her own pocket for students during tests—proof she genuinely cares and isn't just here for a paycheck. She's the sweetest professor, and I'll truly miss having her for Calc and beyond.
Chillest prof on campus fr

Professor Sandee is one of the best math teachers I've ever had. Not because the class is easy but because she cares, it makes a difference! When I struggled all I did was go to her office hours and she helped me with ALL my homework. The final was open note, YES OPEN and she gives extra credit for EVERYTHING. All you have to do is show up and try!

I failed Math 1111 last year before I met Professor Sandee. I'm now taking her for Precalc in the Fall. her only requirements are to show up, participate, and show that you care. She offers extra credit for literally everything, it's impossible to fail her class.

She was so amazing. I took her for quantitative reasoning. I barely showed up to class, she used the Mastering software. All tests were open note, no respondus stuff. And on the tests there were options for 'Help me Solve this' and I got 100's each time. Highly recommend. Math 1001.

Ms. Chandler is amazing and nice. Homework is on mathlab (it is easy, unlimited tries), you have a week to take tests and 2 attempts for ur test in tht week. Due date for hw is at the end of semester. Please take her if u r bad at math!! Especially freshman, perfect class and prof to ease into college.

Very nice teacher and she also cares about your grade. One thing I love about her is that she helps you every step of the way and makes things very easy to understand. I would recommend this class to anyone taking a math or more specifically those who aren't the best at understanding math.

She was awesome! The best prof I've ever taken at KSU! All homework, quizzes, and tests were online and you could go at your own pace. If you cant make it to class, she holds live zoom meetings so you can follow along while she teaches in person. Has an on-call phone for any questions pertaining to classwork. Wish I could take her again and again!!

Watch the lectures, get credits for attendance, do your homework, group quizzes, and all the extra credit and you should be good. I failed basically all the tests except the final & she waived my tests because I was able to study really hard and do well in the final. She's also super duper nice and knows how to explain things. I LOVE PROF SANDEE.

Loved taking her class. I took her for quantitive reasoning, it's a super easy class and she's really passionate about the subject. No tests or quizzes, just group work and you get to pick your group. Attendance is NOT mandatory and there's no test book. Just make sure you have a good calculator! 10/10!

I loved Prof Chandler, super sweet and understanding. All the assignments were on ALEKS and due at the end of the year, which was good, but make sure you don't fall behind. We had a team quiz for each unit, homework, and 4 tests including a final, sounds like a lot but as long as you pace yourself it's an easy A.
So nice and helpful. She talks with her students as well. Her lectures are online and you do class work in the class at your own pace. Everything is due the last day of class.

Professor Sandee is a blessing. I came into this class knowing nothing about math and I was embarrassed. Homework is due at the end of the semester so everyone can move at their own pace.The professor and her learning assistant are always ready to help and walk you through work. I passed the class with an A+. Professor Sandee will not let you fail.

Professor Sandee is amazing! I took MATH 1001. She cares about her students and actually takes the time to know your name. She wants you to pass! There is a lot of homework on MyMathLab, but if you ever have any questions about it, you can email/text her or she will work it out for you in class. It would be harder to fail the class than pass.
Math is our friend! It is very hard not to get an A+ in the class as long as you put in the work.

I absolutely enjoyed this cute little lady. I'm a visual learner & took her over Summer '22 & she was super helpful. Everything is on ALEKS, but she is willing to teach you & show you how to solve problems & get their solution. She LOVES math (Always says "Math is our Friend" lol!) Please take her, she wants you to succeed!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She's an awesome professor! She answered all of my emails and was very helpful with extra credit and the homework. There were a lot of topics in this course, but she went through several problems with the class. She's a very chill professor and her lectures were fantastic!

She is amazing, very loving and caring personality, she needs a raise! 
Most chill professor ever. made math easy to understand at least for me because she was a student and one point and really acts like a student to put things into your perspective. She makes math your friend ;-)

I had professor Sandee for Math 1001, which was a new math course introduced this year! Coming from someone who struggles in math take this professor, super sweet and helps you when needed. The material itself was not difficult, most of the things you do are group project besides the hw, you have unlimited attempts on! Definitely going to miss her!
Easiest math class you'll ever take. Very heavy in ALEKS! Prof. Sandee is also super nice and she cares about her students.

First, she's very sweet. All of the homework and tests are on ALEKS (unless you choose to do paper). She likes participation but it's not required. Attendance was mandatory but she got sick of people talking over her so she changed it to not mandatory. It's probably the easiest math you can take! And she goes through it all (which can get boring)!
I had to work for this class. The professor.. great woman. Got my money's worth. She really helped me ACTUALLY understand math

This class is ALL ALEKS. However, Professor Chandler gives out her personal cell to help outside of class and uploads videos of her teaching each chapter. I took this in the summer so the course was super compact - why I think I got a B. Do all your ALEKS and you'll pass. Come to class.

This is the easiest math class you will take. Every math class has to use Aleks so that sucks. But the only grade in this class is Aleks and the exams the first exam and the final exam are in person the other 2-3 are online each is worth only 9 points including the final!! as long as you do aleks and pass a majority of the exams you will get an A.

Prof. Sandee cares about what she does a lot and is always available to help out. There are group projects and quizzes every week which is a little weird for math class, but otherwise, the class is pretty easy. All of the homework and stuff is done on ALEKS so it's really at your own pace.
shes extremely nice, and really loves what she does. you have to interact with her to get the most out of the class, and her tests are extremely easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: If I could give more stars I could, shes a great teacher and loves helping students with their work, and is always super happy to do so. She's a great person. The class is online but please go to class, she doesn't teach really like a normal class is structured but she will help you if you're stuck on a question. Her whole attitude brightens my day
She is a good professor. Take her! You wont regret it. I took her for summer semester and it was not bad at all. I basically still had a summer.

I took her for the summer and she was great! Math is not my greatest subject but she made the class understandable. Her test reviews are just like her exams, so if you take the time to do those, you'll definitely pass her test.

Very sweet and helpful if you don't understand something. There was quite a lot of homework on ALEKS, but it was a summer semester. A lot of new math concepts, also difficult to memorize all of it in a few weeks. As soon as I thought I had something down we were already on to the next topic. Lots of extra credit.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If not because of tuition, I would've taken her again for the summer semester for pre-cal. She's a very sweet professor, definitely available to help! So much opportunity for extra credit, just put in the hours to study & do hw, ask questions, & take advantage of the extra credit. Also there is some groupwork! I got a "B" in the support class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Chandler is sweet, but she did not give one lecture or teach my class anything. We were required to attend class (for a grade), but we sat in silence and you were expected to do your homework (on material you have to teach yourself). After a few emails, she stopped responding to me so I had to use every resource available just to get by.
Totally online in conjunction with ALEKS software. Very easy/high school level algebra, with the addition of more difficult concepts.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: One of the best professors you could take. This was a fully virtual class, but she made it one the easiest classes ever. You had due dates with lots of homework, but she gives plenty of time to complete it. She is always willing to help, and is great with replying to people. You will definitely love taking this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: Amazing teacher.  If you dont succeed in her class its your fault. Not hers. She is such a good teacher and its hard to find professors like her in college.  If you are taking a basic freshman math shes a no brainer.  Better than most of my high school teachers.

She is so caring. Most homework and quizzes given in my math lab (online). Opportunities for extra credit. If you just need to just get through math take her if you need more of an in depth understanding of the material for harder classes may want to try someone else. Tests are hard. Took calc 1 and Trig.

I'll start off by saying that math is not my strongest subject, but this was such an easy class. LOTS of extra credit. If you do your homework, quizzes, tests, and participation activities, there's no reason not to get an A. Very sweet professor.

I took the online summer course and this was the easiest core class I think I've ever taken. There was a lot of homework, but as long as you try in this class, you will pass. She gave SO many opportunities for extra credit. Just saying, if you need one-on-one help with math, this might not be for you. It's all online and she is not super involved.

She is so sweet, caring, and helpful. She even gave us a google number to text her at if we had issues outside of class. I kind of did not like that we kind of had to teach ourselves with ALEKS but it was an easy A class. She had us in groups to do team quizzes and team worksheets and that helped.

Normally teaches algebra, but also teaches Calc 1. TAKE HER FOR BOTH! She let us choose the grading criteria (ex: 4 exams + final-optional if you have A) which allowed each exam to be worth 5% of our grade. DO THE HOMEWORK it's 65% of grade and infinite retries. She wants you to learn the math and only grades you because she has to. She loves math.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She was honestly the best math professor Ive had. She doesnt lecture in class because shes found its easier to go to the students individually and help them with questions. Group activities are made to help you understand and receive a lecture when necessary but from a student perspective. Highly recommend for those who struggle like me

Professor sandee is such a funny and sweet lady. Everything is done through ALEKS,its basically an online class. If you need any help she is willing to help you. Every week you are given a topic to do your hw and every week you will have a quiz and worksheet to complete. You will be in groups to help you do quiz and WS. Do your work and u will pass

Prof. Sandee is the sweetest woman ever! She is very knowledgeable and all of the material is done through ALEKS! Again, she is very sweet and I was really able to understand math better with her! I would suggest taking her!

Professor Sandee is so sweet! All of the homework is online and so is every test after the first one. Keep in mind this is calculus so you will need to study outside of class. But it is much easier than a typical Calc class. There is also so much extra credit and the homework weighs more than any other area. She is very helpful so ask questions!

Easily the strangest class I've ever been apart of. Nice lady but can't teach at all. Be prepared to hire a tutor bc you'll probably need it. Tests are only 5-6 questions. Loads of homework. Doesn't explain anything. SUPER easy grader. 95% of work is online. I would recommend not going to class b/c it's virtually a waste. oh & "mAtH iS oUr fRiEnD!"
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Prof Sandee is a VERY nice lady, yet her class was frustrating. Her entire class is on Aleks. You would have hw, weekly assignments and quizzes that you would take in a group, and at home tests all on Aleks. Although she is very kind and will help you in class if you need it, she does not teach in class. You must learn almost entirely from Aleks.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Not the best teacher but very sweet. If you do not have background in Calculus you may struggle. Always willing to help if you're struggling with understanding something. All out tests ended up being online which made them easier since she forgets to set the time limits. A good bit of homework for every chapter. Math is our friend as she says

fall 2019 my freshman year. Shes very laid but cant teach. She will answer questions but she cant really get the class to understand how she solves things. I went to class about 60% of the time. All homework and quizzes/test are online so I dont get how people get anything below an A. If you do the homeworks (use ur resources;)) youll be fine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Says "math is our friend" about 25 times every class. She is a very intelligent professor but she cannot teach at all. Tests are only 4-5 questions and homework counts for almost 50% of your grade. Homework can also be difficult at times and cover material not talked about in class, but thankfully, she's a very easy and lenient grader. Avoid if can

Sandee is a cute old lady. There's lots of homework, but it's worth almost half our grade. which means it's a great cushion. The group projects also help your grade. She posts her notes online. She's a great professor if you want a goood grade, but not necessarily great if you want a strong understanding of calculus. Math is our friend :)
Pretty simple class with a clear criteria. Basically an online class. Just do your work and study and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very funny and says "Math is your friend" constantly. She is always willing to help. In class but- ALL content was online including tests. Online "work sheet Wednesdays" and "fun quiz Fridays" EZ and work in groups. Also have out of class projects but are super easy. Definitely recommend, will work with you if you put in minimal effort!

She's such a sweet lady. she is very funny, and you can tell that she loves the subject she teaches. BUT she does not know how to teach at all. I had to work for the grade I got. and the only reason I passed is because she grades point based instead of percentage.

Sweet lady but honestly one of the worst professors I've had. I've always been good at math and never have had to study as much as I did in this one. She read straight from a powerpoint the entire semester and only taught us the very basics of each concept. I spent the entire semester trying to teach myself. Did not work very well. Do not recommend

Says "Math is your friend" every 60 seconds and often doesn't understand how to solve the problem. Don't take this class in the morning. 1/3 of people show up to class most of the time. Otherwise its an easy choice if you don't want to show up and already know the material

Professor Sandee is a super sweet lady. Shes there to help anytime you need her. If you do the homework and quiz for each unit, in which you are given multiple attempts, you will do fine. Her final and midterm both were 10 questions or less and the questions were almost identical to those on the homework. An easy A if you do the work.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Class was completely online even though its a regular course. you practically have to teach yourself. If your not good in math. Take a class where the professor teaches. Prof Sandee is great when you do talk to her a bout a problem. It limits her from being great the way the class is set up. Finish every assignment and you will pass. I mean every

Professor Sandee is a solid choice. She is a sweet lady that is always there if you need any help. You are only graded on a few things and if you have any questions on them she will help you until you have the answer.

Professor Sandee is the best! The class was online using ALEKS. You either like it or you don't. It allows you to work on your own pace, but if you fall behind or don't understand a topic it can really affect your grade. Professor Sandee is always willing to help and is great at explaining anything and gives a lot of extra credit

Very nice lady, but repeats the same math is your friend phrase like 15 times a class period. Also, dont really expect to learn anything from her she doesnt really teach, she just reads the homework questions and gives you the answers

If you take math 1111 with her, a lot of your work will be online and outside of class. If you fall behind it can get pretty overwhelming, but overall it is possible to get a decent grade in this class. She is always very excited to help and answer questions. She explains things very well, and will answer as many questions as you need.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Took her for precalc. Super easy A if you follow along with the Aleks software she uses, which is so helpful with understanding the material. Tests were so easy that I had to make a 65 on the final to make an A in the class. Im taking her for calculus next semester.

Pro. Sandee is absolutely sweetest professor you can have. Her class is easy but she does give a lot of homework. She spends most of class time explaining how to do the homework questions so you can so most of the work in class. You can easily tell how much she loves her job and is always eager to help with any questions or problem you may have.

Horrible professor. She is a very nice lady but her class is EXTREMELY difficult. I had a B the whole semester and got a bad grade on the final and ended up with a C in the class, she did not curve the test and most people failed the class. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.... the homework is hard, it is WAY more in depth than what she teaches in class.
